11:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: gm, are you sure you've bundled font awesome by default in XE?  
11:23 <vmassol> (I see it's mentioned in the RN)  
11:23 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki62M1#HFontAwesome  
11:23 <cjd> /kick vmassol you're on holidays  
11:24 <vmassol> hmm indeed, I forgot! Thanks for the reminder :)  
11:24 <cjd> http://lib.ru/DPEOPLE/PARKINSON/parkinson.txt  
11:24 <cjd> just finished reading it, very good book  
11:25 <cjd> he is totally a troll  
11:25 <vmassol> I'm startig this book ATM: http://www.amazon.com/Zero-Marginal-Cost-Society-Collaborative/dp/1137278463  
11:25 <cjd> ahh, been talking to ludo I see  
11:25 <cjd> I suppose I should take a look at that one too  
11:26 <vmassol> actually no I didn't know ludo had read it before buying it  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I've done it yesterday, yes  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> and with the enterprise I've built this morning, it's ok  
11:26 <gdelhumeau> (I mean XE ^^)  
11:26 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I don't see the dep in the pom.xml but maybe I missed it, you should add it to e.x.o though  
11:26 <vmassol> (right now it doesn't say it's bundled)  
11:27 <cjd> can you quote me a phrase from the page where you're reading? something unique  
11:27 <cjd> (in the zero marginal cost)  
11:28 <vmassol> cjd: nope, cannot yet, haven't started reading yet! (finishing David and Goliath from Gladwell first)  
11:28 <cjd> ahh, if it's on your desk just open to a random page :)  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> he is not supposed to be sitted in front of his desk ;)  
11:29 <vmassol> hmm you should buy it! :)  
11:29 <vmassol> "The transborder parks are a departure"  
11:29 <cjd> thx  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> \*sat  
11:29 <cjd> I don't have room for paper  
11:30 <cjd> google whack!    1 result  
11:31 <vmassol> indeed google returns the pdf….  
11:33 <vmassol> has quit  
11:34 <Enygma`> Hi

11:34 <Enygma`> trying to stabilize the build  
11:34 <Enygma`> please refrain from committing new stuff that can break it  
11:34 <gdelhumeau> ok

15:59 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:28 <msmeria> has quit  
16:51 <EA> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <EA> hello. does anyone know if applying a custom skin across all of our sub-wikis (aka our own wiki farm) is doable?  
16:53 <EA> we want to avoid importing the custom skin space to each sub-wiki. same goes with some other custom configs like our custom macros space.  
16:54 <EA> we had luck with cross-wiki linking certain documents using 2.1 syntax of wiki:Space.Page but not sure how we could do this for applying a custom skin (e.g. Skins.CustomSkin1) across the whole farm (all wikis owned and operated by our internal users)  
17:18 <ClemensR> EA: about the skin, maybe better place it in the file system, if you can ...  
17:19 <ClemensR> about the other pages, maybe package them as an extension,  and distribute them over the Extension Manager (via "Install on farm")  
17:19 <ClemensR> that would make a copy of the stuff into every subwiki, however  
17:21 <EA> re skin on filesystem - you mean making our own subfolder “customskin” inside of /webapps/xwiki/skins/ ? great idea.  
17:25 <ClemensR> yes, that is what I meant  
17:27 <ClemensR> our admins love xwiki updates with skins like that :D  - actually we usually "install" the  in some extra directory and have a script copying them over in the right webapp directory on demand. just in case someone accidentially "cleanes up" the installation when upgrading ;)  
17:27 <EA> i’ll look into the extension manager approach for the macros. thanks for the suggestions.  
17:28 <polx> has quit  
17:29 <evalica> has quit  
17:31 <ClemensR> extension manager: you can package the pages as a \*.xar file in a faux-maven repository in the file system on the server, and activate it via extension.repositories=maven-local-repo:maven:file:///path/to/repo  
17:34 <ClemensR> or even install the http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Repository+Application locally in the main wiki and use this as repo to distribute the pages, using    extension.repositories=localhost:xwiki:http://localhost:8080/xwiki/rest/  :)  ... I have not really tried this in production, however, just in local testing, and that has been a while; but it worked  
17:35 <EA> awesome. thanks!
